We temporarily drop the time index τ\begin{document}$\tau$\end{document} for simplicity. Then, the joint cumulative distribution function Cpk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=Pr[fk+1∗<f∧hk+1∗<h|pk∗]\begin{document}$C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})=\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*} \lt f \wedge h_{k+1}^{*} \lt h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]$\end{document} is(89)Cpk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=∫0fdf′∫0hdh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)=(∫01−∫f1)df′(∫01−∫h1)dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)=∫01df′∫01dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)−∫h1df′∫01dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)−∫01df′∫h1dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)+∫f1df′∫h1dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)=1−Pr[fk+1∗≥f|pk∗]−Pr[hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]+Pr[fk+1∗≥f∧hk+1∗≥h|pk∗].\begin{document}$$\displaystyle C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) = & \, \int_{0}^{f}df'\int_{0}^{h}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ = & \, \left(\int_{0}^{1}-\int_{f}^{1}\right)df'\left(\int_{0}^{1}-\int_{h}^{1}\right)dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ = & \, \int_{0}^{1}df'\int_{0}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-\int_{h}^{1}df'\int_{0}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ & -\int_{0}^{1}df'\int_{h}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})+\int_{f}^{1}df'\int_{h}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ = & \, 1-\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*}\geq f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]-\mathrm{Pr}[h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]+\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*}\geq f\wedge h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}].$$\end{document}

The probability Pr[fk+1∗≥f∧hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]\begin{document}$\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*}\geq f\wedge h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]$\end{document} can be converted as(90)Pr[fk+1∗≥f∧hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]=Pr[fk+1(1)≥f∧hk+1(1)≥h∧fk+1(2)≥f∧hk+1(2)≥h∧⋯∧fk+1(g)≥f∧hk+1(g)≥h|pk∗]=[Pr[fk+1≥f∧hk+1≥h|pk∗]]g=[1−Pr[fk+1<f|pk∗]−Pr[hk+1<h|pk∗]+Pr[fk+1<f∧hk+1<h|pk∗]]g=[1−Cfk+1(f∣pk∗)−Chk+1(h∣pk∗)+Cpk+1(f,h∣pk∗)]g,\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*} &\geq f\wedge h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}] \\ &= \mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{(1)}\geq f\wedge h_{k+1}^{(1)}\geq h\wedge f _{k+1}^{(2)}\geq f\wedge h_{k+1}^{(2)}\geq h\wedge\cdots\wedge f_{k+1}^{(g)} \geq f\wedge h_{k+1}^{(g)}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}] \\ & = \left[\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}\geq f\wedge h_{k+1}\geq h\right| \boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]]^{g} \\ &= \left[1-\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1} \lt f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]-\mathrm{Pr }[h_{k+1} \lt h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]+\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1} \lt h \right|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]]^{g} \\ & = \left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}\left(f \mid p_k^*\right)-C_{h_{k+1}}\left(h \mid p_k^*\right)+C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}\left(f, h \mid p_k^*\right)\right]^g, $$\end{document}

where Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)=∫0fdf′∫0hdh′Ppk+1(f′,h′|pk∗)\begin{document}$C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})=\int_{0}^{f}df^{\prime}\int_{ 0}^{h}dh^{\prime}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f^{\prime},h^{\prime}|\boldsymbol{p}_{k} ^{*})$\end{document} is a conditional joint cumulative distribution function of (f(i),h(i))\begin{document}$(f^{(i)},h^{(i)})$\end{document}. The marginal cumulative distribution functions are(91)Cfk+1(f|pk∗)=∫0fdf′∫01dh′Ppk+1(f′,h′|pk∗),\begin{document}$$\displaystyle C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) = \int_{0}^{f}df'\int_{0}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}), $$\end{document}(92)Chk+1(h|pk∗)=∫01df′∫0hdh′Ppk+1(f′,h′|pk∗).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle C_{h_{k+1}}(h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) = \int_{0}^{1}df'\int_{0}^{h}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}).$$\end{document}

Similarly, the probabilities Pr[fk+1∗≥f|pk∗]\begin{document}$\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*}\geq f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]$\end{document} and Pr[hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]\begin{document}$\mathrm{Pr}[h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]$\end{document} are converted into Pr[fk+1∗≥f|pk∗]=[1−Cfk+1(f|pk∗)]g\begin{document}$\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*}\geq f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]=\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f| \boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}$\end{document} and Pr[hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]=[1−Chk+1(h|pk∗)]g\begin{document}$\mathrm{Pr}[h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]=\left[1-C_{h_{k+1}}(h| \boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}$\end{document}. Thus, the joint cumulative distribution function is(93)Cpk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=1−[1−Cfk+1(f|pk∗)]g−[1−Chk+1(h|pk∗)]g+[1−Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Chk+1(h|pk∗)+Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) = & \, 1-\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}-\left[1-C_{h_{k+1}}(h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}\\ & +\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{h_{k+1}}(h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})+C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}. $$\end{document}

Then, the conditional probability of the selected collective is given by(94)Ppk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=∂2∂f∂hCpk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=g(g−1)[1−Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Chk+1(h|pk−1∗)+Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g−2×(Pfk+1(f|pk−1∗)−∂fCpk+1(f,h|pk∗))(Phk+1(h|pk−1∗)−∂hCpk+1(f,h|pk∗))+g[1−Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Chk+1(h|pk−1∗)+Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g−1Ppk+1(f,h|pk∗),\begin{document}$$\displaystyle P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) = & \, \frac{\partial^{2}}{\partial f\partial h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ = & \, g(g-1)\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{h_{k+1}}(h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k-1}^{*})+C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-2} \\ & \times(P_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k-1}^{*})-\partial_{f}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}))(P_{h_{k+1}}(h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k-1}^{*})-\partial_{h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})) \\ & +g\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{h_{k+1}}(h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k-1}^{*})+C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-1}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}), $$\end{document}

where ∂fCpk+1(f,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$\partial_{f}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document} =∂∂hCpk+1(f,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$=\frac{\partial}{ \partial h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document} =∫0hdh′Ppk+1(f′,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$=\int_{0}^{h}dh^{ \prime}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f^{\prime},h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document} and ∂hCpk+1(f,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$\partial_{h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document} =∂∂hCpk+1(f,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$=\frac{\partial}{ \partial h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document} =∫0fdf′Ppk+1(f′,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$=\int_{0}^{f}df^{ \prime}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f^{\prime},h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document}.

If the mean fk+1,τ¯\begin{document}$\overline{f_{k+1,\tau}}$\end{document} is smaller than fk∗\begin{document}$f_{k}^{*}$\end{document}, the chosen collective is likely to have maximum f\begin{document}$f$\end{document} values among g\begin{document}$g$\end{document} matured collectives. Then, the definition of f∗\begin{document}$f^{*}$\end{document} is written by fk+1∗=max(fk+1(1),fk+1(2),⋯,fk+1(g))\begin{document}$f_{k+1}^{*}=\max(f_{k+1}^{(1)},f_{k+1}^{(2)},\cdots,f_{k+1}^{(g)})$\end{document}. We rewrite the joint cumulative distribution function Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)\begin{document}$C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document} to be a little different from Equation 89 because now we have to utilize the condition f∗<f\begin{document}$f^{*} \lt f$\end{document} instead of f∗>f\begin{document}$f^{*} \gt f$\end{document},(95)Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)=∫0fdf′∫0hdh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)=∫0fdf′(∫01−∫h1)dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)=∫0fdf′∫01dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗)−∫0fdf′∫h1dh′Ppk+1∗(f′,h′|pk∗).=Pr[fk+1∗<f|pk∗]−Pr[fk+1∗<f∧hk+1∗≥h|pk∗].\begin{document}$$\displaystyle C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) &= \int_{0}^{f}df'\int_{0}^{h}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\\ &= \int_{0}^{f}df'(\int_{0}^{1}-\int_{h}^{1})dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ &= \int_{0}^{f}df'\int_{0}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-\int_{0}^{f}df'\int_{h}^{1}dh'P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}). \\ & = \mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*} \lt f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]-\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]. $$\end{document}

The probability Pr[fk+1∗<f∧hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]\begin{document}$\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]$\end{document} is converted as(96)Pr[fk+1∗<f∧hk+1∗≥h|pk∗]=Pr[fk+1(1)<f∧hk+1(1)≥h∧fk+1(2)<f∧hk+1(2)≥h∧⋯∧fk+1(2)<f∧hk+1(2)≥h|pk∗]=[Pr[fk+1<f∧hk+1≥h|pk∗]]g=[Pr[fk+1<f|pk∗]−Pr[fk+1<f∧hk+1<h|pk∗]]g.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{*} & \lt f\wedge h_{k+1}^{*}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}] \\ & = \mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1}^{(1)} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1}^{(1)}\geq h\wedge f_{k +1}^{(2)} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1}^{(2)}\geq h\wedge\cdots\wedge f_{k+1}^{(2)} \lt f\wedge h _{k+1}^{(2)}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}] \\ & = \left[\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1}\geq h|\boldsymbol{p}_{ k}^{*}]\right]^{g} \\ & = \left[\mathrm{Pr}[f_{k+1} \lt f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]-\mathrm{Pr}[ f_{k+1} \lt f\wedge h_{k+1} \lt h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}]\right]^{g} . \end {aligned}$$\end{document}(97)=[Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle =\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}} (f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}.$$\end{document}

Thus, the joint cumulative distribution function is given by(98)Cpk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=[Cfk+1(f|pk∗)]g−[Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})=\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}-\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g}. $$\end{document}

In this case, the conditional probability distribution function is given by(99)Ppk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=∂2∂f∂hCpk+1∗(f,h|pk∗)=g(g−1)[Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g−2×(Pfk+1(f|pk∗)−∂fCpk+1(f,h|pk∗))∂hCpk+1(f,h|pk∗)+g[Cfk+1(f|pk∗)−Cpk+1(f,h|pk∗)]g−1Ppk+1(f,h|pk∗).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) = & \, \frac{\partial^{2}}{\partial f\partial h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ = & \, g(g-1)\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-2} \\ & \times(P_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-\partial_{f}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}))\partial_{h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}) \\ & +g\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-1}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(f,h|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*}). $$\end{document}

By replacing (f,h)\begin{document}$(f,h)$\end{document} to pk+1∗\begin{document}$\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}$\end{document}, we finally obtain the conditional probability distribution Ψ(pk+1∗|pk∗)\begin{document}$\Psi(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})$\end{document},(100)Ψ(pk+1∗|pk∗)={g(g−1)[1−Cfk+1(fk+1∗|pk∗)−Chk+1(hk+1∗|pk∗)+Cpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗)]g−2×(Pfk+1(fk+1∗|pk∗)−∂fCpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗))(Phk+1(h)−∂hCpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗))+g[1−Cfk+1(fk+1∗|pk∗)−Chk+1(hk+1∗|pk∗)+Cpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗)]g−1Ppk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗) for fk+1,τ¯−fk∗≥0 and hk+1,τ¯−hk∗≥0g(g−1)[Cfk+1(fk+1∗|pk∗)−Cpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗)]g−2(Pfk+1(fk+1∗|pk∗)−∂fCpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗))∂hCpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗)+g[Cfk+1(fk+1∗|pk∗)−Cpk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗)]g−1Ppk+1(pk+1∗|pk∗) for fk+1,τ¯−fk∗<0 and hk+1,τ¯−hk∗≥0.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \Psi(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})=\begin{cases} g(g-1)\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f_{k+1}^{*}|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{h_{k+1}}(h_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})+C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-2}\\ \times(P_{f_{k+1}}(f_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})-\partial_{f}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*}))(P_{h_{k+1}}(h)-\partial_{h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*}))\\ +g\left[1-C_{f_{k+1}}(f_{k+1}^{*}|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{h_{k+1}}(h_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})+C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-1}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})\\ \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \text{ for }\overline{f_{k+1,\tau}}-f_{k}^{*}\geq0\text{ and }\overline{h_{k+1,\tau}}-h_{k}^{*}\geq0\\ g(g-1)\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f_{k+1}^{*}|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-2}\\ (P_{f_{k+1}}(f_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})-\partial_{f}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*}))\partial_{h}C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})\\ +g\left[C_{f_{k+1}}(f_{k+1}^{*}|\boldsymbol{p}_{k}^{*})-C_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})\right]^{g-1}P_{\mathbf{p}_{k+1}}(\mathbf{p}_{k+1}^{*}|\mathbf{p}_{k}^{*})\\ \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \text{ for }\overline{f_{k+1,\tau}}-f_{k}^{*} \lt 0\text{ and }\overline{h_{k+1,\tau}}-h_{k}^{*}\geq0 \end{cases}.$$\end{document}

Using Equation 100, we get the mean values of f∗\begin{document}$f^{*}$\end{document} and h∗\begin{document}$h^{*}$\end{document} as(101)fk+1∗¯=∫01df′∫01dh′ f′×Pfk+1∗,hk+1∗(f′,h′|fk∗,hk∗),\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{f_{k+1}^{*}} = \int_{0}^{1}df'\int_{0}^{1}dh'\ f'\times P_{f_{k+1}^{*},h_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|f_{k}^{*},h_{k}^{*}), $$\end{document}(102)hk+1∗¯=∫01df′∫01dh′ h′×Pfk+1∗,hk+1∗(f′,h′|fk∗,hk∗).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{h_{k+1}^{*}} = \int_{0}^{1}df'\int_{0}^{1}dh'\ h'\times P_{f_{k+1}^{*},h_{k+1}^{*}}(f',h'|f_{k}^{*},h_{k}^{*}). $$\end{document}

We define the accessible region in frequency space where the signs of the changes in both F frequency and FF frequency after a cycle are opposite to that of maturation (see Appendix 8—figure 1),(103)sign(fk+1∗¯−fk∗)×sign(fk+1,τ¯−fk∗)≤0 and sign(hk+1∗¯−hk∗)×sign(hk+1,τ¯−hk∗)≤0,\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \mathrm{sign}\left(\overline{f_{k+1}^{*}}-f_{k}^{*}\right)\times\mathrm{sign}\left(\overline{f_{k+1,\tau}}-f_{k}^{*}\right)\leq0\mathrm{\ and\ }\mathrm{sign}\left(\overline{h_{k+1}^{*}}-h_{k}^{*}\right)\times\mathrm{sign}\left(\overline{h_{k+1,\tau}}-h_{k}^{*}\right)\leq0,$$\end{document}

where fk+1,τ¯\begin{document}$\overline{f_{k+1,\tau}}$\end{document} and fk+1∗¯\begin{document}$\overline{f_{k+1}^{*}}$\end{document} are the mean values of F frequencies after the maturation step in cycle k+1\begin{document}$k+1$\end{document} before and after selection, respectively, and h\begin{document}$h$\end{document} values are defined similarly for FF. Or, if the condition is not met, the composition of the selected collective may diverge from the target composition after several cycles. The accessible regions are marked in the gold-colored area in Appendix 8—figure 1b. Similar to the two-population case, the accessible region is shaped by the flow velocity of the composition during the maturation step, as depicted in the flow diagram in Appendix 8—figure 1a. Both F and FF frequencies tend to increase, and the inter-collective selection can compensate for these changes if the composition changes slowly when the F and FF frequencies are small. However, if the changes occur too rapidly when the FF frequency is intermediate, the frequency cannot be stabilized. So the accessible region is limited to the regions where the composition changes slowly.

This is explainable by projecting the three-population problem into the two-population problem. The selective advantage of FF relative to the rest of the collective mainly determines the accessible region. The growth rate of the rest varies from rS\begin{document}$r_{S}$\end{document} to rS+ω\begin{document}$r_{S}+\omega$\end{document} according to F frequency, so the mean growth rate of the rest is written by rS¯=rS+f′ω\begin{document}$\overline{r_{S}}=r_{S}+f^{\prime}\omega$\end{document} where f′\begin{document}$f^{\prime}$\end{document} is F frequency in S+F. Then, the corresponding selective advantage of FF is ω¯=(2−f′)ω\begin{document}$\overline{\omega}=(2-f^{\prime})\omega$\end{document} which varies between ω\begin{document}$\omega$\end{document} to 2ω\begin{document}$2\omega$\end{document}. Using rS¯\begin{document}$\overline{r_{S}}$\end{document} and ω¯\begin{document}$\overline{\omega}$\end{document} similar to Appendix 2, we get bounds of the accessible region (see dashed line in Appendix 8—figure 1b). The boundary from the projected problem agreed well with the original three-population problem.

caption.title: Accessible regions in the three-population system.
caption.p: (a) The flow of composition change in fast-growing (F) and faster-growing (FF) frequencies at each composition (f,h)\begin{document}$(f,h)$\end{document}. Top corner indicates that FF cells fix in the collective. Right bottom corner means collectives with only F cells, while collectives contain S cells only at left bottom corner. Arrow length means the speed of change. (b) The accessible regions are marked by the gold area. If the signs of changes in both F frequency and FF frequency after inter-collective selection are opposite to those during maturation, then the given composition is accessible. Otherwise, the composition is not accessible and will change after cycles. Dashed lines are the boundary of the accessible region by projecting the collective into a two-population problem (FF vs. S+F). The figures are drawn using the mpltern package (Ikeda et al., 2019).

sec.title: Derivation of equations
sec.p: In this section, we go over the derivation of Equations 18–42 for readers not equipped with advanced mathematics training.
Assumptions: μ≪ω,rS\begin{document}$\mu\ll\omega,r_{S}$\end{document}

Equation 18 is straightforwardly solved by integrating Equation 16. Equation 19 is obtained from Equation 17 using integration factor e−(rS+ω)t\begin{document}$e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}$\end{document}:(104)[dF¯(t)dt−(rS+ω)F¯(t)]e−(rS+ω)t=μS¯oe(rS−μ)te−(rS+ω)t,\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \left[\frac{d\overline{F}(t)}{dt}-(r_{S}+\omega)\overline{F}(t)\right]e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}=\mu\overline{S}_{o}e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t}e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}, $$\end{document}(105)d[F¯(t)e−(rS+ω)t]dt=μS¯oe−(ω+μ)t.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d\left[\overline{F}(t)e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}\right]}{dt}=\mu\overline{S}_{o}e^{-(\omega+\mu)t}. $$\end{document}

Integrating both sides, we get F¯(t)e−(rS+ω)t−F¯(0)=μS¯oω+μ(1−e−(ω+μ)t)\begin{document}$\overline{F}(t)e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}-\overline{F}(0)=\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}} {\omega+\mu}\left(1-e^{-(\omega+\mu)t}\right)$\end{document}. Thus,(106)F¯(t)=F¯oe(rS+ω)t+μS¯oω+μ(e(rS+ω)t−e(rS−μ)t)≈F¯oe(rS+ω)t+μS¯oω(e(rS+ω)t−erSt).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{F}(t) = \overline{F}_{o}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{\omega+\mu}\left(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t}\right)\approx\overline{F}_{o}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{\omega}\left(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t}\right).$$\end{document}

Applying Equation 12, we have(107)dS2¯dt=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞S2dP(S,F,t)dt=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[rSS2(S−1)P(S−1,F,t)+S2(rS+ω)(F−1)P(S,F−1,t)+μ(S+1)S2P(S+1,F−1,t)−(rS+(rS+ω)F+μS)S2P(S,F,t)].\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d\overline{S^{2}}}{dt} &= \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}S^{2}\frac{dP(S,F,t)}{dt}\\ &= \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}[{\color{purple}r_{S}S^{2}(S-1)P(S-1,F,t)}+{\color{purple}{\color{blue}S^{2}(r_{S}+\omega)(F-1)P(S,F-1,t)}}\\ &+{\color{red}\mu(\text{S}+1)S^{2}P(S+1,F-1,t)}-({\color{purple}rS}+{\color{blue}(r_{S}+\omega)F}+{\color{red}\mu S})S^{2}P(S,F,t)].$$\end{document}

We collect the two purple-colored terms and change the order of summation. Note that the first purple-colored term does not change regardless of whether S\begin{document}$S$\end{document} starts from 0 or 1 because the term is zero for S=0\begin{document}$S=0$\end{document}. Thus, the first purple-colored term is equivalent to ∑F=0∞∑S=1∞[rSS2(S−1)P(S−1,F,t)]\begin{document}$\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\sum_{S=1}^{\infty}\left[r_{S}S^{2}(S-1)P(S-1,F,t)\right]$\end{document}. Let α=S−1\begin{document}$\alpha=S-1$\end{document} , and this becomes ∑F=0∞∑α=0∞[rS(α+1)2αP(α,F,t)]\begin{document}$\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\sum_{\alpha=0}^{\infty}\left[r_{S}(\alpha+1)^{2}\alpha P(\alpha,F,t)\right]$\end{document}. We reassign α as S\begin{document}$S$\end{document}, and obtain:(108)∑F=0∞∑S=0∞[rS(S+1)2SP(S,F,t)]−∑F=0∞∑S=0∞rSS3P(S,F,t)=rS∑F=0∞∑S=0∞[(2S+1)S]P(S,F,t)=rS(2S2¯+S¯).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle & \sum_{F=0}^{\infty} \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\left[r_S(S+1)^2 S P(S, F, t)\right]-\sum_{F=0}^{\infty} \sum_{S=0}^{\infty} r_S S^3 P(S, F, t) \\ & =r_S \sum_{F=0}^{\infty} \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}[(2 S+1) S] P(S, F, t) \\ & =r_S\left(2 \overline{S^2}+\overline{S}\right). $$\end{document}

We collect the two blue terms, and similarly obtain:(109)∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[S2(rS+ω)(F−1)P(S,F−1,t)−(rS+ω)FS2P(S,F,t)]=(rS+ω)∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[S2FP(S,F,t)−FS2P(S,F,t)]=0.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle & \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\left[S^{2}(r_{S}+\omega)(F-1)P(S,F-1,t)-(r_{S}+\omega)FS^{2}P(S,F,t)\right]\nonumber \\ &= (r_{S}+\omega)\sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\left[S^{2}F\,P(S,F,t)-FS^{2}P(S,F,t)\right] \\ & =0. $$\end{document}

Finally, we collect the two red terms. For the first red term, the sum is the same regardless of whether we start from S=0\begin{document}$S=0$\end{document} or -1. Let S\begin{document}$S$\end{document} start from -1, and we have(110)∑F=0∞∑S=−1∞[μ(S+1)S2P(S+1,F−1,t)].\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\sum_{S=-1}^{\infty}\left[\mu(S+1)S^{2}P(S+1,F-1,t)\right]. $$\end{document}

Let α=S+1,\begin{document}$\alpha=S+1,$\end{document} then the term becomes ∑F=0∞∑α=0∞[μα(α−1)2P(α,F−1,t)]\begin{document}$\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\sum_{\alpha=0}^{\infty}\left[\mu\alpha(\alpha-1)^{2}P(\alpha,F-1,t)\right]$\end{document}. We reassign α as S\begin{document}$S$\end{document}, and additionally apply index change on F−1\begin{document}$F-1$\end{document}:(111)μ∑F=0∞∑S=0∞[S(S−1)2P(S,F,t)−S3P(S,F,t)]=μ∑F=0∞∑S=0∞[(−2S2+S)P(S,F,t)]=μ(−2S2¯+S¯).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle & \mu\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\left[S(S-1)^{2}P(S,F,t)-S^{3}P(S,F,t)\right] \\ & =\mu\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\left[(-2S^{2}+S)P(S,F,t)\right] \\ & =\mu\left(-2\overline{S^{2}}+\overline{S}\right). $$\end{document}

Now, add the three parts together, and we have(112)dS2¯dt=μ(−2S2¯+S¯)+rS(2S2¯+S¯)=2S2¯(rS−μ)+S¯(rS+μ),\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d\overline{S^{2}}}{dt} &= \mu\left(-2\overline{S^{2}}+\overline{S}\right)+r_{S}(2\overline{S^{2}}+\overline{S}) \\ & = 2\overline{S^{2}}(r_{S}-\mu)+\overline{S}(r_{S}+\mu), $$\end{document}

which is Equation 24. Likewise,(113)dF2¯dt=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞F2dP(S,F,t)dt=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[rSF2(S−1)P(S−1,F,t)+F2(rS+ω)(F−1)P(S,F−1,t)+μ(S+1)F2P(S+1,F−1,t)−(rSS+(rS+ω)F+μS)F2P(S,F,t)]=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[rSF2S+(F+1)2(rS+ω)F+μS(F+1)2−(rSS+(rS+ω)F+μS)F2]P(S,F,t)=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[(F+1)2(rS+ω)F+μS(F+1)2−((rS+ω)F+μS)F2]P(S,F,t)=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[(rS+ω)F(2F+1)+μS(2F+1)]P(S,F,t)\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d\overline{F^{2}}}{dt} &= \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}F^{2}\frac{dP(S,F,t)}{dt} \\ &= \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}[{\color{purple}r_{S}F^{2}(S-1)P(S-1,F,t)}+{\color{purple}{\color{blue}F^{2}(r_{S}+\omega)(F-1)P(S,F-1,t)}} \\& +{\color{red}\mu(S+1)F^{2}P(S+1,F-1,t)}-({\color{purple}r_{S}S}+{\color{blue}(r_{S}+\omega)F}+{\color{red}\mu S})F^{2}P(S,F,t)] \\ &= \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\left[{\color{purple}r_{S}F^{2}S+{\color{purple}{\color{blue}(F+1)^{2}(r_{S}+\omega)F}{\color{red}+\mu S(F+1)^{2}}-({\color{purple}r_{S}S}+{\color{blue}(r_{S}+\omega)F}+{\color{red}\mu S})}}F^{2}\right]P(S,F,t) \\ &= \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\left[{\color{purple}{\color{blue}(F+1)^{2}(r_{S}+\omega)F}{\color{red}+\mu S(F+1)^{2}}-({\color{blue}(r_{S}+\omega)F}+{\color{red}\mu S})}F^{2}\right]P(S,F,t) \\ &= \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\left[(r_{S}+\omega)F(2F+1)+\mu S(2F+1)\right]P(S,F,t) $$\end{document}(114)=2(rS+ω)F2¯+(rS+ω)F¯+2μS¯F¯+μS¯\begin{document}$$\displaystyle = 2(r_{S}+\omega)\overline{F^{2}}+(r_{S}+\omega)\overline{F}+2\mu\overline{S}\overline{F}+\mu\overline{S}$$\end{document}
which is Equation 25.

Using integration factor e−2(rS−μ)t\begin{document}$e^{-2(r_{S}-\mu)t}$\end{document} and Equation 24, we have:(115)[dS2¯dt−2(rS−μ)S2¯]e−2(rS−μ)t=(rS+μ)S¯oe(rS−μ)te−2(rS−μ)t,\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \left[\frac{d\overline{S^{2}}}{dt}-2(r_{S}-\mu)\overline{S^{2}}\right]e^{-2(r_{S}-\mu)t} = (r_{S}+\mu)\overline{S}_{o}e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t}e^{-2(r_{S}-\mu)t}, $$\end{document}(116)d[S2¯e−2(rS−μ)t]dt=(rS+μ)S¯oe(μ−rS)t,\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d\left[\overline{S^{2}}e^{-2(r_{S}-\mu)t}\right]}{dt} = (r_{S}+\mu)\overline{S}_{o}e^{(\mu-r_{S})t},$$\end{document}(117)S2¯e−2(rS−μ)t=rS+μμ−rSS¯o[e(μ−rS)t−1]+S2¯o.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{S^{2}}e^{-2(r_{S}-\mu)t} = \frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\left[e^{(\mu-r_{S})t}-1\right]+\overline{S^{2}}_{o}. $$\end{document}

Since μ≪rS\begin{document}$\mu\ll r_{S}$\end{document}, we have(118)S2¯=rS+μμ−rSS¯o[e(μ−rS)t−1]e2(rS−μ)t+S2¯oe2(rS−μ)t≈S¯oe2rSt[1−e−rSt]+S2¯oe2rSt,\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{S^{2}} & = \frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\left[e^{(\mu-r_{S})t}-1\right]e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}+\overline{S^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}\\ & \approx \overline{S}_{o}e^{2r_{S}t}\left[1-e^{-r_{S}t}\right]+\overline{S^{2}}_{o}e^{2r_{S}t}, $$\end{document}

where S2¯o\begin{document}$\overline{S^{2}}_{o}$\end{document} is the expected S2\begin{document}$S^{2}$\end{document} at time 0. For Equation 28,(119)σS2(t)=S2¯(t)−[S¯(t)]2≈S¯oe2rSt[1−e−rSt]+S2¯oe2rSt−(S¯oerSt)2=S¯oe2rSt[1−e−rSt]+e2rSt(S2¯o−(S¯o)2)=S¯oe2rSt[1−e−rSt]+e2rStσS2(0).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \sigma_{S}^{2}(t) & = \overline{S^{2}}(t)-[\overline{S}(t)]^{2} \\ & \approx \overline{S}_{o}e^{2r_{S}t}\left[1-e^{-r_{S}t}\right]+\overline{S^{2}}_{o}e^{2r_{S}t}-\left(\overline{S}_{o}e^{r_{S}t}\right)^{2} \\ & = \overline{S}_{o}e^{2r_{S}t}\left[1-e^{-r_{S}t}\right]+e^{2r_{S}t}\left(\overline{S^{2}}_{o}-\left(\overline{S}_{o}\right)^{2}\right)=\overline{S}_{o}e^{2r_{S}t}\left[1-e^{-r_{S}t}\right]+e^{2r_{S}t}\sigma_{S}^{2}(0). $$\end{document}

Since S F¯=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞SFP(S,F,t)\begin{document}$ \overline{S\ F}=\sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}S\,F\,P(S,F,t)$\end{document},(120)dSF¯dt=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[SFrS(S−1)P(S−1,F,t)+SF(rS+ω)(F−1)P(S,F−1,t)+SFμ(S+1)P(S+1,F−1,t)−SF(rSS+(rS+ω)F+μS)P(S,F,t)]=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[(S+1)FrSS+S(F+1)(rS+ω)F+(S−1)(F+1)μS−SF(rSS+(rS+ω)F+μS)]P(S,F,t)=∑S=0∞∑F=0∞[2rSSF+ωSF−μSF+μS2−μS)]P(S,F,t)=(2rS+ω−μ)SF¯+μ(S2¯−S¯).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d\overline{S\:F}}{dt} = & \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty} \big[S\:Fr_{S}(S-1)P(S-1,F,t)+S\:F(r_{S}+\omega)(F-1)P(S,F-1,t) \\ & +S\:F\mu(S+1)P(S+1,F-1,t) \\ & -S\:F(r_{S}S+(r_{S}+\omega)F+\mu S)P(S,F,t) \big] \\ = & \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\big[(S+1)Fr_{S}S+S(F+1)(r_{S}+\omega)F+(S-1)(F+1)\mu S \\ & -S\:F(r_{S}S+(r_{S}+\omega)F+\mu S) \big]P(S,F,t) \\ = & \, \sum_{S=0}^{\infty}\sum_{F=0}^{\infty}\left[2r_{S}S\:F+\omega S\:F-\mu S\:F+\mu S^{2}-\mu S)\right]P(S,F,t) \\ = & \, (2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)\overline{S\:F}+\mu(\overline{S^{2}}-\overline{S}). $$\end{document}

We can solve this, again using the integration factor technique above:(121)d[SF¯e−(2rS+ω−μ)t]dt=μ(S2¯−S¯)e−(2rS+ω−μ)t.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \frac{d[\overline{S\:F}e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}]}{dt} = \mu(\overline{S^{2}}-\overline{S})e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}. $$\end{document}

Thus, we have(122)SF¯e−(2rS+ω−μ)t−SF¯o=μ∫(S2¯−S¯)e−(2rS+ω−μ)tdt=μ∫(rS+μμ−rSS¯o[e(μ−rS)t−1]e2(rS−μ)t+S2¯oe2(rS−μ)t−S¯oe(rS−μ)t)e−(2rS+ω−μ)tdt=μ∫(rS+μμ−rSS¯o[e−(μ−rS)t−e2(rS−μ)t]e−(2rS+ω−μ)t+S2¯oe2(rS−μ)te−(2rS+ω−μ)t−S¯oe(rS−μ)t−(2rS+ω−μ)t)dt=μ∫(rS+μμ−rSS¯oe−(rS+ω)t−rS+μμ−rSS¯oe−(μ+ω)t+S2¯oe−(μ+ω)t−S¯oe−(rS+ω)t)dt=μ{2rSμ−rSS¯oe−(rS+s)t−1−(rS+ω)+(S2¯o−rS+μμ−rSS¯o)e−(μ+ω)t−1−(μ+ω)},\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{S\:F}e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}-\overline{S\:F}_{o} = & \, \mu\intop(\overline{S^{2}}-\overline{S})e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}dt \\ = & \, \mu\intop\Biggl(\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\left[e^{(\mu-r_{S})t}-1\right]e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}\\ & +\overline{S^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}-\overline{S}_{o}e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t}\Biggr)e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}dt \\ = & \, \mu\intop\Biggl(\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\left[e^{-(\mu-r_{S})t}-e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}\right]e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t} \\ & +\overline{S^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}e^{-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}-\overline{S}_{o}e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t-(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}\Biggr)dt \\ = & \, \mu\intop\Biggl(\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}-\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}e^{-(\mu+\omega)t} \\ & +\overline{S^{2}}_{o}e^{-(\mu+\omega)t}-\overline{S}_{o}e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}\Biggr)dt \\ = & \, \mu\Biggl\{\frac{2r_{S}}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\frac{e^{-(r_{S}+s)t}-1}{-(r_{S}+\omega)}\\ & +\left(\overline{S^{2}}_{o}-\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\right)\frac{e^{-(\mu+\omega)t}-1}{-(\mu+\omega)}\Biggr\},$$\end{document}

which results in(123)SF¯(t)=SF¯oe(2rS+ω−μ)t+μ{2rSμ−rSS¯oe−(rS+ω)t−1−(rS+ω)+(S2¯o−rS+μμ−rSS¯o)e−(μ+ω)t−1−(μ+ω)}e(2rS+ω−μ)t=SF¯oe(2rS+ω−μ)t+2rSμμ−rSS¯oe(rS−μ)t−e(2rS+ω−μ)t−(rS+ω)+μ(S2¯o−rS+μμ−rSS¯o)e2(rS−μ)t−e(2rS+ω−μ)t−(μ+ω)≈SF¯oe(2rS+ω)t−2μS¯orS+ω(e(2rS+ω)t−erSt)+μω(S2¯o+S¯o)(e(2rS+ω)t−e2rSt).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{S\:F}(t) = & \, \overline{S\:F}_{o}e^{(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}+\mu\left\{ \frac{2r_{S}}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\frac{e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t}-1}{-(r_{S}+\omega)}+(\overline{S^{2}}_{o}-\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o})\frac{e^{-(\mu+\omega)t}-1}{-(\mu+\omega)}\right\} e^{(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}\\ = & \, \overline{S\:F}_{o}e^{(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}+\frac{2r_{S}\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\frac{e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t}-e^{(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}}{-(r_{S}+\omega)} \\ & +\mu\left(\overline{S^{2}}_{o}-\frac{r_{S}+\mu}{\mu-r_{S}}\overline{S}_{o}\right)\frac{e^{2(r_{S}-\mu)t}-e^{(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t}}{-(\mu+\omega)} \\ \approx & \, \overline{S\:F}_{o}e^{(2r_{S}+\omega)t}-\frac{2\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{r_{S}+\omega}\left(e^{(2r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t}\right)+\frac{\mu}{\omega}(\overline{S^{2}}_{o}+\overline{S}_{o})\left(e^{(2r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{2r_{S}t}\right). $$\end{document}

From Equation 25, we have(124)(dF2¯dt−2(rS+ω)F2¯)e−2(rS+ω)t=d(F2¯e−2(rS+ω)t)dt=((rS+ω)F¯+2μSF¯+μS¯)e−2(rS+ω)t.\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \left(\frac{d\overline{F^{2}}}{dt}-2(r_{S}+\omega)\overline{F^{2}}\right)e^{-2(r_{S}+\omega)t}=\frac{d\left(\overline{F^{2}}e^{-2(r_{S}+\omega)t}\right)}{dt}=\left((r_{S}+\omega)\overline{F}+2\mu\overline{S\,F}+\mu\overline{S}\right)e^{-2(r_{S}+\omega)t}. $$\end{document}

Note that we have checked that the second and third terms of SF¯\begin{document}$\overline{SF}$\end{document} can be ignored after we compare the full calculation with this simpler version. Integrate both sides:(126)F2¯e−2(rS+ω)t−F2¯o≈(rS+ω)(F¯oω+N0μ(ω+μ)(rS+ω)(1−e−(rS+ω)t)+μS¯o(ω+μ)(rS+2ω+μ)(e−(rS+2ω+μ)t−1))+2μSF¯oω+μ(1−e−(ω+μ)t)+μS¯orS+2ω+μ(1−e−(rS+2ω+μ)t)+o(μ2)\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{F^{2}}e^{-2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-\overline{F^{2}}_{o} \approx & \, (r_{S}+\omega)\Biggl(\frac{\overline{F}_{o}\omega+N_{0}\mu}{(\omega+\mu)(r_{S}+\omega)} \left(1-e^{-(r_{S}+\omega)t} \right) \\ & +\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{(\omega+\mu)(r_{S}+2\omega+\mu)} \left(e^{-(r_{S}+2\omega+\mu)t}-1 \right)\Biggr) \\ & +\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega+\mu}(1-e^{-(\omega+\mu)t})+\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{r_{S}+2\omega+\mu}\left(1-e^{-(r_{S}+2\omega+\mu)t})+o(\mu^{2} \right)$$\end{document}

Then, we have(127)F2¯(t)≈F2¯oe2(rS+ω)t+(rS+ω)(F¯oω+N0μ(ω+μ)(rS+ω)(e2(rS+ω)t−e(rS+ω)t)+μS¯o(ω+μ)(rS+2ω+μ)(e(rS−μ)t−e2(rS+ω)t))+2μSF¯oω+μ(e2(rS+ω)t−e(2rS+ω−μ)t)+μS¯orS+2ω+μ(e2(rS+ω)t−e(rS−μ)t)+o(μ2)=F2¯oe2(rS+ω)t+(F¯oω+N0μω(e2(rS+ω)t−e(rS+ω)t)+(1ω−1rS+2ω)μS¯o(erSt−e2(rS+ω)t))+2μSF¯oωe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−erSt)+μS¯orS+2ω(e2(rS+ω)t−erSt)+o(μ2)=F2¯oe2(rS+ω)t+2μSF¯oωe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−erSt)+F¯oe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−1)+μS¯oω[(−e(rS+ω)t)+F¯oS¯o(e2(rS+ω)t−e(rS+ω)t)+2ωrS+2ωe2(rS+ω)t+rSrS+2ωerSt]+o(μ2)=F2¯oe2(rS+ω)t+2μSF¯oωe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−erSt)+F¯oe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−1)+μS¯oω[(−e(rS+ω)t)+2ωrS+2ωe2(rS+ω)t+rSrS+2ωerSt]+μF¯oω(e2(rS+ω)t−e(rS+ω)t)+o(μ2)=F2¯oe2(rS+ω)t+2μSF¯oωe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−erSt)+F¯o(1+μω)e(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−1)+μS¯oω[(−e(rS+ω)t)+2ωrS+2ωe2(rS+ω)t+rSrS+2ωerSt]+o(μ2)=F2¯oe2(rS+ω)t+2μSF¯oωe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−erSt)+F¯oe(rS+ω)t(e(rS+ω)t−1)+μS¯oω[(−e(rS+ω)t)+2ωrS+2ωe2(rS+ω)t+rSrS+2ωerSt]+o(μ2).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle \overline{F^{2}}(t) \approx & \, \overline{F^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+(r_{S}+\omega)\Biggl(\frac{\overline{F}_{o}\omega+N_{0}\mu}{(\omega+\mu)(r_{S}+\omega)}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}) \\ & +\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{(\omega+\mu)(r_{S}+2\omega+\mu)}(e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t}-e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t})\Biggr) \\ & +\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega+\mu}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(2r_{S}+\omega-\mu)t})+\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{r_{S}+2\omega+\mu}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(r_{S}-\mu)t})+o(\mu^{2}) \\ = & \, \overline{F^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\left(\frac{\overline{F}_{o}\omega+N_{0}\mu}{\omega}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+\left(\frac{1}{\omega}-\frac{1}{r_{S}+2\omega}\right)\mu\overline{S}_{o}(e^{r_{S}t}-e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t})\right) \\ & +\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t})+\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{r_{S}+2\omega}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t})+o(\mu^{2}) \\& = \overline{F^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t})+\overline{F}_{o}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-1) \\ & +\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{\omega}\left[(-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+\frac{\overline{F}_{o}}{\overline{S}_{o}}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+\frac{2\omega}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{r_{S}}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{r_{S}t}\right]+o(\mu^{2}) \\ = & \, \overline{F^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t})+\overline{F}_{o}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-1) \\ & +\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{\omega}\left[(-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+\frac{2\omega}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{r_{S}}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{r_{S}t}\right]+\frac{\mu\overline{F}_{o}}{\omega}(e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+o(\mu^{2}) \\ = & \, \overline{F^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t})+\overline{F}_{o}(1+\frac{\mu}{\omega})e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-1) \\ & +\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{\omega}\left[(-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+\frac{2\omega}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{r_{S}}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{r_{S}t}\right]+o(\mu^{2}) \\ = & \, \overline{F^{2}}_{o}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{2\mu\overline{S\:F}_{o}}{\omega}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-e^{r_{S}t})+\overline{F}_{o}e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}(e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t}-1) \\ & +\frac{\mu\overline{S}_{o}}{\omega}\left[(-e^{(r_{S}+\omega)t})+\frac{2\omega}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{2(r_{S}+\omega)t}+\frac{r_{S}}{r_{S}+2\omega}e^{r_{S}t}\right]+o(\mu^{2}). $$\end{document}

mml:mtable.columnalign: right left right left right left right left right left right left

sec.p: To derive this equation, we use the fact that 1/(1+x)∼1−x\begin{document}$1/(1+x)\sim 1-x$\end{document} for small x\begin{document}$x$\end{document}. We will omit (t)\begin{document}$(t)$\end{document} for simplicity. Also, note that we are considering relatively large populations so that the standard deviation is much smaller than the mean.(129)f≈F¯+σFGFS¯+σSGS+F¯+σFGF=F¯(1+σFF¯GF)(S¯+F¯)(1+σSGS+σFGFS¯+F¯)≈F¯S¯+F¯(1+σFF¯GF)(1−σSGS+σFGFS¯+F¯)≈f¯(1+σFF¯GF−σSGS+σFGFS¯+F¯)=f¯(1+(σFF¯−σFS¯+F¯)GF−σSS¯+F¯GS).\begin{document}$$\displaystyle f & \approx \frac{\overline{F}+\sigma_{F}G_{F}}{\overline{S}+\sigma_{S}G_{S}+ \overline{F}+\sigma_{F}G_{F}} \\ & =\frac{\overline{F}\left(1+\frac{\sigma_{F}}{\overline{F}}G_{F} \right)}{(\overline{S}+\overline{F})(1+\frac{\sigma_{S}G_{S}+\sigma_{F}G_{F}}{ \overline{S}+\overline{F}}}) \\ & \approx \frac{\overline{F}}{\overline{S}+\overline{F}}\left(1+\frac{ \sigma_{F}}{\overline{F}}G_{F}\right)\left(1-\frac{\sigma_{S}G_{S}+\sigma_{F}G _{F}}{\overline{S}+\overline{F}}\right) \\ & \approx\overline{f}\left(1+\frac{\sigma_{F}}{\overline{F}}G_{F}-\frac{ \sigma_{S}G_{S}+\sigma_{F}G_{F}}{\overline{S}+\overline{F}}\right) \\ & =\overline{f}\left(1+\left(\frac{\sigma_{F}}{\overline{F}}-\frac{ \sigma_{F}}{\overline{S}+\overline{F}}\right)G_{F}-\frac{\sigma_{S}}{\overline {S}+\overline{F}}G_{S}\right). $$\end{document}
